comments: The PARI functions t1, t2 can be used to read a triangular array T(n,k) (n >= 0, 0 <= k <= floor(n/2)) by rows from left to right: n -> T(t1(n), t2(n)).a(n) gives the number of distinct positive values taken by [n/k]. E.g., a(5)=3: [5/{1,2,3,4,5}]={5,2,1,1,1}. - _Marc LeBrun_, May 17 2001This sequence gives the elements ranged in increasing order of the set {i+2j} when (i>=0, j>=0). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Sep 22 2012
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
M. Somos, Sequences used for indexing triangular or square arrays
formula: a(n) = [sqrt(4*n + 1)] - 1. 1 + a(n) = A000267(n).a(n) = Sum{ A063524(A075993(n, k)): 1<=k<=n} for n>0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 06 2006a(n) = ceil(2*sqrt(n+1)) - 2. - _Mircea Merca_, Feb 05 2012
author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 13 2000
